website_summaries.verdict: This model gives dog owners an option that includes durability and beauty, but the high price makes it impractical for many users.
pros: The Merry Products dog crate with cover offers practicality and beauty and comes in three sizes
The wood veneer cover makes it look attractive in any room
cons: Though this crate is aesthetically pleasing, we found that it may not be durable enough for strong, active dogs

customer_reviews.title: Junk, flimsy, so mad I didn't return this ASAP
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but not at all sturdy >: ( The wire crate is so flimsy that I can almost bend the 'bars' with my mind. The wood side posts don't sit in place well and shift and move anytime the crate is bumped. There is a front wood slat that is supposed to be held in place by magnets (I guess) but it falls off all of the time. I'm super disappointed... I spent a lot of money on an honest to God piece of junk. It's basically a sofa table.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyB

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in November, as a gift for my mother. Held up fine for about 1 month. She just informed me it's been falling apart, coming apart at the bottom, all the dowels coming loose in one corner since then and it is now June! This made it so when her Dalmatian inside the cage moved around, the leg would fall off and the dog could reach through and try to get nearby items with her paw. Very poorly made in my opinion. Pros: Large, looks nice while it's together. Works as intended as long as it states together. Cons: Falls apart after short amount of them. Causes legs to fall off just from dog moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Alan glander

customer_reviews.title: ) and not as sturdy as I was hoping
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to use as side tables in my living room for my Shar pei and Pitbull. They are a little taller than I expected (I probably should have paid more attention to the dimensions listed on the description.) and not as sturdy as I was hoping. However, they do look very nice & I'm interested to see how well they hold up. The bottom piece & front legs don't like to stay in place. My dogs can be a little hyper at times & knock them out of place when they are getting in & out of their kennels. But overall I'm happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: DSMAmy

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog crate
customer_reviews.text: very nice looking dog crate. It is a little "flimsy" and I wouldn't recommend for an aggressive dog or a dog who does not like to be in a crate. We got the large size crate and it suited my expectations. It is a tad smaller than the large dog crate that you get in other stores. A large German Shepherd could fit in there comfortably. I am not sure how well that will hold up over time considering the wood veneer is of marginal quality. However, it looks very nice in my den.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad...
customer_reviews.text: The metal crate itself is horrible...very cheap...and would not hold up a destructive dog...but I bout this for the wood/furniture and like it very much. Easy to put together and functions very well. I intend on replacing the crate with a much better quality one at some point. Update: THE CRATE AND WOOD STRUCTURE ARE NOT 42" AS ADVERTISED... I ordered new crates thinking they would fit within the wood structure... nope.... dont fit... what a WASTE
customer_reviews.author: Mel Kel

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and is easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice and is easy to put together, however the price doesn't match the quality. The wood frame is simply held together by magnets and the top rests on the corner pieces. So if you have to move the crate the front corner pieces fall out. I expected a better quality of wood and construction with this price point. Looks nicer than a plain wire crate, but the price is way too high.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnie Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Makes crates attractive
customer_reviews.text: I have the largest size for my Corgi. He eats his meals in it and stays in it when I leave for errands. The wires are not quite as strong as the plain similar crate, but they have held up just fine. It's a nice looking piece of furniture. The way this one is constructed, the dogs cannot eat the wood which is a good thing. Plenty of visibility and ventilation too.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, we have to put our dog kennel near our front door. It's the first thing you see when you come into our house and this looks much better than a plain wire kennel. It was a bit annoying to get the top on, but I shouldn't have to take it off anytime soon. My lab loves his new den and I love that I can put a lamp on top.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get this
customer_reviews.text: So many things wrong. One, the front door of this came on crooked so it wouldn’t even close. I had to take it off and put it back on myself. Two, the crate doesn’t even FIT in the frame it was sent it. it’s off by a whole inch. Only two of the corners fit properly and that makes the top at an angle. I still need a crate and the only option is a return- I can’t even email the seller to talk. EDIT: in this I even have the corner pieces off to see if there’d be more room to fit it but nope.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Overpriced Cage
customer_reviews.text: I continue to have mixed feeling about this dog cage. The no-fastener way the wood pieces come together makes for a flimsy array that is subject to falling apart. We decided to just use the cage without all the thin woodwork that obscures the dog's view. He is very pleased with the large cage and new Kong mattress I put in it. So it has value but not so much as originally designed, in my view. The wires in this cage seem a bit under sized so there is a frailness to it and the doors are not well aligned with the locking mechanism so they can be difficult to open and close. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh man

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy design, flimsy packaging, vastly overpriced. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. Went downhill from there. Wire cage is very weak. The wood pieces are very difficult to fit together. The packaging does not protect the product. Had to try to modify the unit after the dog collapsed the entire thing in less than 15 minutes. Each modification improved the security, but eventually just fell apart. That took about a week. It would have been better to just make the d@mn thing with my limited skills.
customer_reviews.author: Niceguy

customer_reviews.title: Great huge crate
customer_reviews.text: Love this crate. Blends in with furniture better than standard crates. Dog loves it. Huge - my 70lb shepherd has plenty of room to stand, move around, stretch out. Only complaints are the wood panels/slat frame slide into place and don't screw/lock in, so when moving/cleaning, the wood parts fall apart and it's somewhat difficult to realign and fit into place. Bought a large Kong bed which fit perfectly inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Greco

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking crate!
customer_reviews.text: This is an attractive and durable crate to keep in my family room. Let's be real, this is not a high quality piece of furniture; however, it is a nice looking piece that does the job. It was easy to assemble and I can keep my dog close by without having a large cage-like crate in the room. I got the Large for my Goldendoodle puppy to grow into and it came with a nice divider so I could easily crate train her at the size needed. We have already moved the divider twice and soon won't need it at all!
customer_reviews.author: S.B.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Lab but not my Golden great quality and looks great
customer_reviews.text: It fits my Labrador Retriever but NOT my Golden Retriever. My lab is taller than my golden but both weigh the same. I wish this came in an XL and came with a partisan for growing puppies. It is great and I have had it now for 2 years with no problems. The pieces do fall off the sides when moved but I have not had any problems with anything appearing to be flimsy. Overall I am very glad we purchased it. It is worth the money and looks nice in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great dog cage really nice
customer_reviews.text: I'm downsizing and have to sell this , in trying to come to a fair price for re-sale I see the price has been lowered I paid in the mid $200. everyone who saw this in the 2 yrs I had it loved the crate blended right in with my room . probably not much demand anymore hence the lower price disappointed at the $$ drop was well made
customer_reviews.author: Nickki

customer_reviews.title: Basically Trash
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about this product is that I threw it away. Since it was falling apart as soon as I got it, I did some repairs - to no avail. It went ahead and fell apart anyway. So, for quality I give it a 1 out of 10, but for design, now that's a different story. The design of the wood frame easily gets a 2 out of 10, since it wasn't immediately noticeable how exceptionally atrocious the product was.
customer_reviews.author: Gib

customer_reviews.title: Great looking an well build kennel
customer_reviews.text: Great kennel. Very easy to put together love that you dont have to screw or bolt anything all wood just slides into place. Frount wood has magnets to hold in place . Very well packaged. Love that it's going to be simple to break down when we move. I love this worth every penny. Looks great in the living room not like a plan kennel.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Beck

customer_reviews.title: The product is nice, it seems sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: The product is nice, it seems sturdy and well built. The crate itself is a little flimsy, but the outside wood parts were very nice. The measurements given are for the crate and do not include the exterior wood, so when it is all put together it is about two inches longer on each side. I needed to fit the crate in a specific area, and that four inches made it too large and I need to return it. Frustrating to be given the wrong dimensions on a product you order! But it is good quality and if it fit, I would be keeping it!
customer_reviews.author: Shannonm

customer_reviews.title: Strong, nice to look at, and big!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I was afraid it’d be too small, even with the given measurements that sufficed, but it’s perfect! My 7-month old pup is a HUGE pupper and he can comfortably sit up, stand, and lay down without looking restricted in space. He is also a HUGE chewer and he hasn’t been able to get out of the crate from biting. It also looks great in our living room!
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: If you have a dog who is an escape artist I would recommend using a sturdier crate than the one provided
customer_reviews.text: This is sharp looking crate cover. However, I have a dog who enjoys his cage. If you have a dog who is an escape artist I would recommend using a sturdier crate than the one provided. The crate itself is very flimsy. The table parts on the other hand are very nice and definitely help hide how terrible a large stand alone crate can be. There are no screws or assembly it simply snaps together over the top of the cage. This is great for someone like me but if you have a more "active" dog I'd suggest maybe screwing the pieces together yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product!
customer_reviews.text: Currently using for both a dog crate, and an end table in our living room, and it looks and works perfectly! The assembly was very easy as well! I even bought a cute lamp to put on the top too! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tosh

customer_reviews.title: looks good, but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: the wood is just placed on, not secured. but the real hassle is that the wire kennel is flimsy and can be pushed through. larger dogs can overpower it. plus it is a non-standard size, so you can't swap in a study standard sized large kennel. Grrrr.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Awful!!!!! The crate itself is cheap. The wood portion is NOT locked, bolted or screwed together. Everything is literally loosely held in place by placing the lid on the top. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, especially if you have a medium/large dog.
customer_reviews.author: Shandi

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, cover does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Everything received quickly, but this “cover” is very flimsy and does not lock into place AT ALL. We can’t even get the front bottom piece to stay on at all. I would not purchase this again. I wish I would have know this before buying, I never would have gotten it. The pieces basically just lean up against each other, so any minor movement, it comes crashing down. Totally defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Young

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice.... needs to be tweaked a little in the design
customer_reviews.text: There are NO directions with this product. The 4 corner side pieces alphabetic letters on them with no corresponding letters to show you where they are supposed to go. The little piece At the side Door that allows you to Remove the tray for cleaning is also an awkward fit. It was actually so tight that it cause the base to come apart at 1 of the seams. It would have been much easier if that peace had hinges on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for a large dog
customer_reviews.text: The crate cover is beautiful, looks nice, and foldable crate is easy to set up, but neither are strong enough for a large dog. My dog is only 45 lbs and has already bent the crate, knocked off the cover and framing. The crate itself MUST be able to handle a large dog and unfortunately it does not. I am looking for a sturdier crate in the same size so that I can still use the framing. The cover and framing is too loose -- I know it needs to be so that it is easier to clean, get the crate out, etc, but it needs to secure better than it does.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Reda

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Our 30lb dog was able to break out of this cage. He broke on end and then was able to get out the main door. Yes, it was assembled correctly and yes, the door was latched.
customer_reviews.author: KDuffy

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice. Serves its purpose. Not very sturdy. The front lower wood piece falls off whenever I move it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: flimsy cage/cheap wood
customer_reviews.text: This is a free standing dog cage that you put a frame around. The frame can be removed and the cage used on its own. The frame is sort of flimsy and falls apart if the dog wiggles too much. It barely makes having a dog cage in my living room more attractive. The wooden top is not very strong so don't put anything too heavy on it. I purchased the large size for my pit bull and after trying to get out of the cage a few times she bent it enough to escape.
customer_reviews.author: lauralyn

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for the first few months.... Then the dog easily destroyed it. The metal bends easily and movement caused the legs to fall( legs fall because they are held up with the top and bottom of the crate. They are not attached in any way. If you look closely.... There is a German Shepard in the crate and she w a s fine in there for a bit.
customer_reviews.author: M.NJ

customer_reviews.title: Crate with Cover
customer_reviews.text: This piece really fits well in my living room and blends nicely with my furniture. It is not something that can be moved from place to place so make sure you assemble close to where you want to place it. One small piece of wood came off the bottom but can easily be glued back on. I thought there was sometime wrong with the door latches but you simply have to lift them all the way up to disengage. I love not having an ugly dog crate in my living room! I placed a plant and picture on top and it looks really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking crate
customer_reviews.text: Love this crate and so does my dog. Provides a nice bit of cover from the lights in the room, but still gives my dog a good field of vision. Cons: Was damaged upon delivery and 2 pieces broke off. Solid structure, but the corners are glued on and don't hold very well (had to retape a corner that broke off) The slideout tray cover magnets are absolutely useless. Other than the 2 broken pieces it's great. Luckily I was able to glue it back on myself without any trouble and hide those imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: dezymondTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Received this and box was damaged. It was obvious that it was return previously, as you could tell by the way the box had been removed taped. Upon opening the box, the wood was scratched and the corners were coming apart. Before unpacking any further, I revived and sent it back. Poor quality. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Not the right brand received.
customer_reviews.text: After setting up the multiple parts that fall apart at the slightest nudge, I realized the brand noted was not the brand received. Falls apart at the slightest touch.
customer_reviews.author: Eve S

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...Poor Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I have a sixty-five pound dog and he loves this create. He took to it immediately. It actually passes quite well as furniture. We have a lamp and two picture frames sorting on it comfortably. My only complaint is that the tabletop came with a dent and the wood chipped out from one of the long sides that is quite noticeable. Also, one of the corners was crushed and the wood was chipped. That is why I am giving it three stars.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Removed them so still works as a table top but does not look as nice without the front pieces
customer_reviews.text: 3 front pieces, the side legs and front floor piece will not stay on. Pop off everytime dog moves in crate. Removed them so still works as a table top but does not look as nice without the front pieces. Tried using command strips to hold in place but still popped off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice dog crate.
customer_reviews.text: This is a classy looking piece and for that reason bought it for our 2 medium sized dogs to set in living room. No fault of the seller but It was kinda the white elephant in the room - way to bulky for our smaller house. We ended up putting it in our bedroom. The top comes in handy for setting stuff on but we could've done without such a nice crate now that it's out of sight for anyone but ourselves. I do like that it has a gate on the front and on the side. For the right house it would be perfect. It was alot easier than I expected to collapse and move to another room.
customer_reviews.author: pcarte

customer_reviews.title: perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: Now my dog has her own bedroom. this x-large cage is beautiful. easy to assemble. If your dog is powerful it might be able to bend the cage as the wire is not as heavy as my last cage. however my 60 plus pound Labrador puppie loves it and at 8:30 p.m. goes in willingly of course her bed is in there. two puppy treats , and she now sleeps all night, before she saw light the top must keep out the light. We don't hear from her until 7a.m. everyone we know have dogs, and all agree this is a beauty.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and sturdy enough for your dog to sleep ...
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and sturdy enough for your dog to sleep and lay in. It is very nice looking and it is a part of our furniture now. it is our flat screen TV stand and the dog feels very safe it in . She loves it. Whenever she feels uneasy or the kids are too loud she goes in Once assembled though do not expect to move it without it becoming unstable. The legs come out and you have to put them back in before continuing.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Smith

customer_reviews.title: Looks great with good functionality
customer_reviews.text: Looks great with good functionality! Pros: Easy to put together and take apart. The crate itself can stand alone without the cover, and can be easily collapsed for travel. Overall it's sturdy and looks good in our living room. Cons: I've had the same problem mentioned in other reviews that my dog kicks out the front bottom segment of the cover constantly. But truthfully, it looks fine without it, so we just leave it off.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was going to be so nice but, what a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was going to be so nice but, what a piece of junk. Very unstable when you put it together. The wood pieces dont lock into place they just kind of free stand. The side pieces just sit in place under the heavy top and the whole thing just leaned. The cage itself seemed thin and the handles on the doors were poor quality as well. Seemed like it was going to be durable and the wood quality is nice but the assembly needs to be redesigned. Too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Madbarbee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect crate!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this crate!! We are getting a puppy soon and I wanted a crate that could also function as a side table. It was SUPER easy to put together and looks absolutely amazing in our living room next to our sofa! I also love that it comes with a little divider you can place on the inside to make the crate smaller for the puppy-stage of crate training. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Wire crate should be sturdier
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our GSD, to replace a sturdy yet unattractive heavy-duty wire crate in our living room. We paid only about $70 for the latter. We were disappointed that the new crate is not as sturdy and is a couple inches smaller. If our dog really wanted out of the new crate, she could burst through. The whole unit is a little wobbly. The wooden frame is very nice, flawless in appearance, and it makes for an attractive piece of furniture. Too bad the crate is not more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: North 1

customer_reviews.title: Bent and easily broken out of
customer_reviews.text: The metal is thin and easily bent by my 60lb dog. He also figured out how to weasel off the bottom latch and get out. It isn’t very stable so to have anything on top is a bit terrifying As for the end table part, the sides don’t fit correctly so they either can’t be put on or you have a lopsided table. If you do get them in, they tend to fall of anyway.
customer_reviews.author: KVE

customer_reviews.title: Looks really pretty. I bought the large and its really really ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks really pretty. I bought the large and its really really big. I have a 55lb yellow lab and she can stand up fine with head down a little bit. its sturdy but not easy to move. would probably go with medium next time. I put Velcro on bottom molding piece. little magnets don't hold bottom front wood strip. it has a side & front doors for convenience. JaneB
customer_reviews.author: KSchmidt

customer_reviews.title: Quality, stylish, great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My Beagle & I love this crate! Easily assembled, safe, & very attractive - frankly, the most attractive dog crate I have ever seen. I bought the large....boy it is HUGE. Big enough for a labrador! But I wanted room for a bed, a pee pad & play area....she has it. We got a coop cup to attach to the side so she won't spill her water dish - perfect. I like the 2 doors & removable tray for cleaning. Without a doubt, I would purchase this again. Literally, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: The wood part looks nice but is pretty flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The wood part looks nice but is pretty flimsy, especially the small panel at the bottom that covers the gap where you can pull the plastic tray out. that things falls off all the time without even being touched. I like the crate and the crate cover, but wish the crate cover were designed slightly better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and construction
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this dog crate. It serves a duel purpose in our family room as a safe place for our dog and as a table top next to our couch. This saved so much space in our small room and is well made to look like just another piece of furniture. Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Meeches

customer_reviews.title: Corner posts aren't secure and wobble. Front bottom is ...
customer_reviews.text: Corner posts aren't secure and wobble. Front bottom is just a wood strip with three tiny magnets that don't stay put and falls off every day along with the front two posts getting lose. After some home remedies with tape and foam they will stay still. Cage is HUGE and aside from the previous comment, I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price point. Considering the cost, I couldn’t be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish but a little flimsy...
customer_reviews.text: Very stylish crate. First crate came damaged from shipment. Amazon replaced immediately. Second was delivered with no issues. The crate looks nice and matches the rest of my furniture in the living room. The bottom piece of wood is very flimsy and I have had to reglue a couple of joints because they started coming apart. Despite that, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly behind a loveseat
customer_reviews.text: I love this sofa table crate cover!!! It is not real wood but that doesn’t matter to me. It’s a beautiful addition to my open floor plan living room, dining room and kitchen. I purchased the 4” memory foam pad and cover also on amazon. My 4 little mutts love their comfy den!
customer_reviews.author: martinkathy892

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: easy to put together A lot bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Appearance is good. Is bigger than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Appearance is good. Is bigger than I expected. Construction is not solid. The uprights are not secured in place but held in place by the weight of the top. I had to secure the uprights with screws. Once assembled and secured with screws the crate works well. Looks good. As others have said, the wire of the crate is not as sturdy as most crates. That said, the dogs seem to like it.
customer_reviews.author: JTSievering

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cage. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cage. Easy to assemble. Read reviews and was afraid to order a medium for each of my English Bulldog and Boxer. The large is way too large. I ordered 2. It's like a dining room table. Since I have put them together, I don't want to disassemble and return. They are really beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: moxley

customer_reviews.title: It's attractive
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a table...but it is actually a lot bigger than I was expecting. It is essentially a cover for a regular crate. The legs on one side keeps falling off because the legs are just decorative. The crate itself is what holds everything up so you cannot really put anything too heavy on it. My dog tends to wag quite a bit when excited and tends to shake up the whole crate so I cannot put anything on top that will topple over. Otherwise, I have gotten compliments on how pretty it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Marie PT

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose item.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this. It doubles as his den to watch outside and I can put decorative items on top. I get lots of compliments on this when people see this.
customer_reviews.author: Lu Ann M

customer_reviews.title: No screws comes apart cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved this crate today. The cage is some thin metal . The whole table part just rests on the cage theres no screws to hold it together at all. Whe. you go to move it it all comes apart . Honestly worst purchase ever . Hope my dog doesnt destroy this cage in one day .
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as it looks in the picture
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this product is that it comes apart easily. My dogs are constantly knocking the tray cover peice across the room and the front side are always having to be put back in.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob D Marze

customer_reviews.title: If you can DIY, I highly suggest it.
customer_reviews.text: Crate itself is very lightweight and flimsy. The wood looked great for a minute and then the finish was very easily dulled and scratched. The front piece we threw out because it fell off so often. A lot of money for the quality. We sold ours on Craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: JaeWeg

customer_reviews.title: This would have been a nice crate if it was delivered in good condition
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a nice crate if it was delivered in good condition. When I opened the box, pieces of broken wood fell out, and others were partially broken when I took them out of the box. The wood pieces on the side do not stay in place, and I had to hold them together with bungee cords. Once it is together, it looks nice, but very cheaply made for such an expensive product!!
customer_reviews.author: Babette

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking dog crate... Just a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a really good looking piece of furniture for it being a dog crate. The crate itself is not super thick metal so it does bend a little easy and this also makes it a little wobbly. The removable wood bottom piece that you can remove to clean the crate pan falls of a lot. I would recommend it if you have a calmer dog who does not lean on the crate a lot.
customer_reviews.author: john walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept, so so quality
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice cover for the wire kennel but a bit flimsy. Bottom front panel does not stay in place. Looking at solutions such as Velcro tabs. With a fix for the bottom front panel and a little better quality, this would be a home-run...but it's ok quality if you're not too fussy.
customer_reviews.author: buytoomuch

customer_reviews.title: Practical and more esthetically pleasing
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough for a 55 pound crate-trained standard poodle, yet blends so much better with living room with its outer wood camouflage. The dog loves it, and it also functions as a side table.
customer_reviews.author: Kate L.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this crate with so much hope for my ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this crate with so much hope for my new puppy (Standard Poodle). It was sooo cute! However, the crate was flimsy and the wood pieces continued to fall of with little effort from my dog. The first time she escaped this crate, we simply added caribeaner hooks to the door latches...This photo is of the second escape. I think the crate must be made for chichiua's only.
customer_reviews.author: KDub1

customer_reviews.title: nice looking crate
customer_reviews.text: Good communication with seller. My 100lbs bullmastiff fits in here just fine. It is a standard large crate that comes with wooden outer frame that really makes a difference in the appearance of the room. Will be buying another for the rest of the dogs. Wish somebody sold just the wooden pieces so you don't end up with extra crates.
customer_reviews.author: ipq

customer_reviews.title: Great !!!
customer_reviews.text: This looks wonderful in my living room for my dog. I didn’t want a plain large kennel looking ugly.
customer_reviews.author: Care526

customer_reviews.title: This kennel looks much better in the picture than it in reality
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced! This kennel looks much better in the picture than it in reality. The wood trim is very thin and the wire cage is not very sturdy, as my 70lb dog was able to get out of it by bending the door. Now, I'm stuck with a broken crate. Grr....
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Kirtley

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to leave bad reviews but wow this kennel is poorly made. Don’t get me wrong it looks decent but the metal to the cage is easily bent. The “wood” part can be easily pushed out of place. Also the plastic part bottom of the cage slips and slides out and can easily be broken too. For the price I paid I’m really disappointed. Don’t waste your money , buy something (anything) else.
customer_reviews.author: Asher Okuma

customer_reviews.title: KEEP AWAY
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It could easily lead to injuring your dog through shabby construction. DON'T waste your money on this crate
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Better looking than a wire cage.
customer_reviews.text: This pen is much better looking than a wire cage. It isn't put together very sturdy. The legs are just set in place. It seems to stay together, and will be easy to take apart & move. The latches aren't very strong but my dog doesn't fight them. If you have a dog that fights the pen it probably can bend the latch. My dog loves this pen she sleeps in it when she doesn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: endroad

customer_reviews.title: Nice crate for those that want a little better than "normal" crates.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and attractive. We got two of these to crate our Holden retrievers. The crates are roomy, and comfortable (add a memory foam pad and you are in business) and the crates blend right in with our furniture! The latches are a bit irritating, but overall we are happy.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P. Danner

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart at slightest movement
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt fit together right. Pieces just fall at slightest touch. Would return but the cage is a necessary for when I work and returned my loaner cage.
customer_reviews.author: trina aubrey

customer_reviews.title: The corner boards kept coming out
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with the cage as much as I paid for this should not be this flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: I love the crate but it can scratched in some of ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the crate but it can scratched in some of the places. I didn't want to bother with a return so I just face the part with the scratches against the wall so it is not visible.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Woods

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money...looking to replace after 1 month.
customer_reviews.text: The crate is not strong and is somewhat flimsy. My puppy escaped twice by bending the door enough to unlatch the bottom and squeeze out! I had to put a padlock on it and also had to put a clasp on the tray holder to keep her from pushing it out!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Koczat

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome but could be made better
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks really good, most people don't even notice its a cage.. they think its some sort of end table or something! Only downside is the front piece along the bottom connects by these weak magnets and gets knocked off every single time the dogs go in or out, because their feet hit it. Really bad placement for last piece to fit in. Other than that its awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Browder

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Looks very nice in the pictures...mine came damaged with huge smashed edge of the top. looks nice when put together and super easy to assemble. the front bottom wooden piece is cheap and if the dog makes big movements it just falls off (held on by two magnets). slide out tray is nice if the dog has an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Horse

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great crate - so much so that I bought a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great crate - so much so that I bought a second one for my second dog. I like the look of the wood (it doesn't look cheap at all), and I've found the crate itself to be very sturdy. My dogs are older, though, and aren't escape artists, so I don't have to worry too much about this. I highly recommend if you want a classy looking crate for your living space.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. My dog can’t chew it since the wood is on the outside. Super easy set up
customer_reviews.author: david castro

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have two German Shepherds that love these crates. These are sturdy crates that give my dogs plenty of room. They also seem to enjoy being able to see out without the obstruction of other kennels. When visitors come to the house they compliment the classiness of the kennel. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: I love this crate for my little 5-lb dynamo.
customer_reviews.text: As big as this is, it actually works for me. I have room for my Maltese's bed in one end and pads/food in the other. It is a conversation piece. People love the idea of Diva having a prominent place in the living room of my apt. She is safe, when company comes. It is an elegant "crate." Also easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Corners of table crushed
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these. They both came damaged. Each corner of the table tops are crushed. would like to send them back but I need them. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like that it’s multi-functional so it freed up a bit of space. My dog broke the black base first time she was in it so need to figure out what I can put in there in replace of it. It seems sturdy. Overall I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ended up spending about $25 on some good fasteners that will stand the test of time and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but boy is this thing CHEAP... You really need to install fasteners to secure the 4 uprights to both the base and top. I ended up spending about $25 on some good fasteners that will stand the test of time and look very nice after installation.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Size is of the wood exterior not kennel inside. Looks good and easy to assemble. Wood only held together by friction. Could glue and screw but the lose portability. Wire fairly weak.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good cage
customer_reviews.text: Decent cage ... looks nice so far my 71 lbs Rott still fits abs sleep in it
customer_reviews.author: 1RN4GOD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2 small dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This crate is more affordable than the Frontgate version. Of course, you get what you paid for. Strong enough for my 2 small dogs but I will not recommend this large crate for an active large dog.
customer_reviews.author: 2 dogs & a Lady

customer_reviews.title: Nice little place for my pet
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive addition to my home. Legs seem to fall off with little provocation. Very sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The product is very nice looking. However it is not nearly well put together, nor does it stay together all that well. And the cage is not sturdy either. My medium sized dog has bent almost every bar on the door of the cage from just excitement when my significant other or me get home and let her out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C Wright

customer_reviews.title: do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: The crate looked beautiful and bigger than normal, however, the create is very flimsy and will not hold up the wood. We have had this item for about two weeks and the tray in the bottom is already broken. So it is NOT sturdy, the tray and the cage is very thin and flimsy and will NOT hold up. I DO NOT recommend this product. It has one star because you have to choose a star.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Looks like high end furniture
customer_reviews.text: We have this in out 5th wheel for out German Shepard.
customer_reviews.author: Danger731

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made and not standard size bottom tray
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is made from compressed particle board. The manufacturer is the only place you can get a bottom replacement from and they are $50. Spend the extra and get a better kennel.
customer_reviews.author: Cadance

customer_reviews.title: The kennel itself standard and sturdy but the cover is held together by placing one ...
customer_reviews.text: While this crate does have eye appeal don't expect to be able to move it or bump into it without it falling apart. The kennel itself standard and sturdy but the cover is held together by placing one the legs in the corner nooks and the roof on top of those.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: The crate and frame were pretty simple to put together
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews for this kennel we went ahead and purchased it for our new Border Collie puppy. The crate and frame were pretty simple to put together. The wooden top is of a good and sturdy weight. She is very comfortable in the kennel. As the frame is not meant to be screwed together she is able to push the lower frame piece in front of the door off but that would be our only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Gilligan

customer_reviews.title: Great Wood Exterior, Weak tensile strength on metal cage
customer_reviews.text: Love the wood exterior, however, our dog destroyed the cage door within two weeks. Needs a stronger cage, as other users have pointed out...which I will find a replacement to fit in the dimensions of the wood. I would give a 5 if this company starts to offer sturdier metal cages.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Delivered Broken
customer_reviews.text: The idea is fantastic. We were looking for a place for our dogs that looked like it fit in with the rest of the furniture in our house. Basically what you are paying for here is the wooden frame around what is a normal dog cage. The issue we have had is that the wooden frame was BADLY damaged when ours was shipped. The top piece was broken on two corners, and one corner piece was split in half when we got it. I complained but to no avail. The cage would look nice if we had received what we ordered, but at this point we payed WAY too much for a dog cage and some cheap broken wood.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Crate is awesome I have a German Shepard.easy setup it's not made for you to slide all over the house. Pick a location then setup or do like me lowes sales L-brackets with screws for 1.39$ only if you want to keep moving
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Dog Crate!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and love that it looks like a piece of furniture. We have it bedside and we use as an end table. Purchased for full size collie and she loves it! It's her little home. When we can't find her, we look in the crate and there she is!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This was WAY too big for our 75-pound lab - wish I would've gotten a medium size. It is a beautiful color and much better than the plastic eye-sore we had. But it is quite flimsy. The front panel that removes so you can take the tray out NEVER stays on... it has just 3 or 4 magnets and they are not strong enough to handle movement by the dog. Also, the wire crate itself is not sturdy, and the wooden part comes in pieces: corner pieces, bottom, and top, so they tend to move around as well. I would purchase it again because it is half the price of others, but wish the measurements and description were better.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Rawls

product_meta.title: Merry Products Pet Cage with Crate Cover, Large
product_meta.description:
A Solid Crate Cover that comes with metal crate turning the crate into a functional table surface, while its original structure is kept intact to keep the pet confined, without limiting the pet's visibility or comfort.

AMAZON.COM


ABOUT US:
WITH ITS EXPERTISE IN WOOD AND A PASSION FOR PETS, MERRY PRODUCTS DEVELOPED THE WORLD RENOWNED MERRY PET COLLECTION. THIS EXCLUSIVE LINE OF WOOD PET HOUSES AND FURNITURE HAS RECEIVED TREMENDOUS RECOGNITION IN THE MARKET PLACE FOR ITS SUPERIOR QUALITY, BEAUTIFUL CRAFTSMANSHIP AND UNIQUE DESIGN THAT COMPLIMENTS BOTH INDOOR DÉCOR AND OUTDOOR LANDSCAPE. AT MERRY PRODUCTS, WE ARE DEDICATED TO CONTINUED CREATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF PET HOUSES AND FURNITURE THAT ARE AESTHETICALLY PLEASING, INTELLIGENTLY FUNCTIONAL AND COMPETITIVELY PRICED.
CAGE WITH CRATE COVER-LARGE:
PRODUCT DESCRIPTION:
Style and functionality come together in one with the Merry Products Cage with Crate Cover Set. The set comes with black powder-coated fully functional free standing steel crate and a Mahogany brown elegantly designed solid wood cover. The cover turns an ordinary pet crate into an attractive and functional side table for your living room, family room and/or bedroom. The metal crate also comes with a removable plastic tray at the bottom of the crate for easy cleaning. In addition, a removable stainless steel crate divider is included allowing for partitioning of the interior space for successful crate training of your puppies. This remarkable cage with crate cover comes in 3 different sizes to accommodate most dog breeds. Extremely easy assembly and dis-assembly, no hardware is required. Design patent granted. 

FEATURES AND SPECIFICATIONS:
- INCLUDES A REMOVABLE PLASTIC TRAY FOR EASY CLEANING
- INCLUDES A REMOVABLE DIVIDER IN THE CENTER OF THE CRATE
- MADE FROM MDF WITH A SOLID WOOD VENEER AND POWDER COATED STEEL
- THE CAGE IS FULLY FUNCTIONAL WITHOUT THE WOOD PARTS FOR EASY TRANSPORTATION
- EASY ASSEMBLY AND DISASSEMBLY - NO HARDWARE REQUIRED!
feature_bullets: Dimensions(WxDxH): External: 28.7" x 43.4" x 30.1", Internal: 26.14" x 40.87" x 25.4"; Door: 16" x 23"
Panels cover the main components of the crate giving the crate a more finished and interior-appropriate appearance like furniture.
Our solid crate top allows personal items to be stored on top, taking full advantage of the surface area with no effect on the crate or pet inside.
Includes removable plastic tray that can be pulled out for cleaning purposes
Made with MDF with solid wood veneer and powder coated steel; Wire gauge 6 (4.33 mm)
Easy to set up with slide-fit wood panels, with no hardware or tools needed.
